question: Deserts such as the Sahara are generally found between 20° and 30° latitudes in the western parts of the continents. This is because these regions?
option1: Have off-shore winds throughout the year
option3: Lie in the belt of the doldrums
option4: Are very hot throughout the year
answer: Have off-shore winds throughout the year
explanation: The areas between 20 ° -30 ° latitude on western margins of continents are the regions of descending air. Because of this, the air gets compressed and warm as it descends and thus the moisture keeps decreasing.
